problem_text_en:
In a box-shaped water tank with dimensions $4 \mathrm{~m} \times 2 \mathrm{~m} \times 1 \mathrm{~m}$, the height of the water is $25 \mathrm{~cm}$. The tank is then turned on its side (see picture on the right). How high is the water in the tank now?
<image1> A. $25 \mathrm{~cm}$
 B. $50 \mathrm{~cm}$
 C. $75 \mathrm{~cm}$
 D. $1 \mathrm{~m}$
 E. $1.25 \mathrm{~m}$
